title: Teaching Professor, Gies RC Evans Innovation Fellow, CITL Fellow
biography: Lawrence Angrave is a Teaching Professor at the Siebel School of Computing and Data Science at the University of Illinois. He is also a Gies RC Evans Innovation Fellow and a CITL Fellow. His research focuses on accessible education and effective computer science instruction at scale. He has received numerous teaching and research honors and is actively involved in various service roles within the university and the broader community.

professionalHighlights.organization: Center for Innovation in Teaching & Learning

researchStatement: Lawrence Angrave's research focuses on accessible education and effective computer science instruction at scale. He is particularly interested in the use of technology to enhance learning experiences and make education more inclusive.

researchInterests.description: Researching and developing tools and methods to make education more accessible to all students, including those with disabilities.

researchInterests.area: Effective Computer Science Instruction at Scale
researchInterests.description: Exploring innovative teaching methods and technologies to improve the quality and reach of computer science education.
